articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 11th in D (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 11th in D

An arpeggio is the notes of a chord played individually in a sequence. The 11th arpeggio in D is a musical figure built on the 1st, 3rd, 5th, and 11th notes of the D major scale. In this particular arpeggio, we extract the notes D, F#, A, and G to create a harmonious sequence.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (1st note) - Root
- F# (3rd note) - Major 3rd
- A (5th note) - Perfect 5th
- G (11th note) - Perfect 11th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th arpeggio in D is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and R&B music genres. It adds a jazzy, sophisticated flavor to the music due to the inclusion of the 11th note, which extends the harmonic richness of the chord. This arpeggio can bring a sense of tension and release, creating a lush and colorful sound in compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 11th arpeggio in D:
1. *"So What"* by Miles Davis - This iconic jazz piece prominently features the D 11th arpeggio in its chord progressions.
2. *"I Wish"* by Stevie Wonder - The funky groove of this R&B classic includes the D 11th arpeggio in certain sections.
3. *"Bright Size Life"* by Pat Metheny - This jazz fusion composition showcases the use of the D 11th arpeggio in its intricate guitar passages.
